metadata.Description: The process of developing strategies and plans to increase access to electricity in a specific area or region.

subelement_relations.Description: Grid extension involves expanding the existing electricity grid infrastructure to reach areas that currently lack access to electricity. It includes the installation of transmission lines, transformers, and distribution networks to connect households and businesses to the grid.

Off-grid solutions refer to decentralized electricity generation systems that are not connected to the main electricity grid. These solutions often rely on renewable energy sources such as solar panels, wind turbines, or small-scale hydroelectric systems to provide electricity to remote or isolated areas.

Demand-side management involves implementing strategies and technologies to optimize energy consumption and reduce peak demand. It includes measures such as energy efficiency programs, load shifting, and demand response initiatives to ensure efficient and sustainable use of electricity.

Energy access planning focuses on developing strategies and policies to ensure universal access to affordable, reliable, and modern energy services. It involves assessing energy needs, identifying barriers to access, and designing interventions to overcome these barriers and improve energy access for all.

Renewable energy integration involves incorporating renewable energy sources into the electricity grid system. It includes the planning, design, and implementation of infrastructure and technologies to enable the seamless integration of renewable energy generation, such as solar and wind power, with the existing grid infrastructure.
